newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia stocks end short session up a touch.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia stocks end short session up a touch.

text.p: 10yrbond futs 92.480 +0.020 Gold NY 368.75 Lon fix 368.70
*Stocks ended a shortened session just firmer on light volume ahead of the Christmas break. Volume 195.1 million, value A$380.4 million, 934 stocks traded, 283 steady, 380 up, 271 down.
Australian shares closed just firmer on light volume with most investors absent from a shortened session ahead of the Christmas break on Wednesday and Thursday.
The benchmark All Ordinaries index closed 0.9 points firmer at 2,381.4, off its intra-session low of 2,386.2.
At 1.10 p.m (0210 GMT), the December share price index was 11 points up at 2,397, a 15.6 point premium to the physical.
The stock of Westpac Banking Corp was easily the busiest issue on the day after it went ex-dividend, paying a final dividend of 17 cents a share.
"It was a reasonably positive day for the market given the Westpac factor and the fact that so many players were absent," a Sydney-based dealer said.

Investor focus remained on the shares of regional banks Advance and St George which continued to travel in opposing directions after Advance shareholders approved a scheme to merge with St George on Monday.
Advance shares closed six cents higher at A$6.96 while St George shares ended 13 cents weaker at A$7.75.
The shares of beverage group Coca-Cola Amatil lent support to the market as they continued to recover from recent weakness.

In other markets, Australian bonds had a fairly uneventful shortened session ahead of the two-day Christmas holiday with yields off slightly, which was purely a reflection of a firm U.S. Treasury market on Thursday.
The yield on 10-year T-bonds closed at 7.44 percent, down 0.01 percentage point from Monday's close.
The Australian dollar extended its softly, softly rally by another 1/4 cent at the midsession even as the local market wound down early for the Christmas holidays.
At 1.10 p.m. (0110 GMT), the unit was quoted at US$0.7994/99.
Short-term range Support Restnce RSI-14 MA-10 MA-20
Advance shares continued to rise and St George stock continued to fall after Advance shareholders approved a scheme for the two banks to merge on Monday.
Bank's shares went ex-dividend paying a final dividend of 17 cents and topping the day's turnover.

Highlands said it would respond by January 6 next year to the latest offer by Placer Dome Inc which has said it was willing to cancel its interest in Highlands and pay A$276.8 million for Highlands' 25 percent stake in the Porgera gold mine in PNG.
Ausdoc said Brambles' A$2.00 per share bid was unacceptable.
-- Michael Stapleton, Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
